meanings.definition: The act of persistently biting or chewing on something.
meanings.sent1: The mouse's gnawings on the wooden door left visible marks.
meanings.sent2: The gnawings on the bone indicated that a dog had been there.
meanings.sent3: The gnawings on the pencil made it look like a beaver had visited the classroom.
meanings.sent4: The gnawings of time slowly erode even the strongest of structures.
meanings.sent5: The gnawings of hunger in his stomach made him realize he had skipped lunch.

meanings.definition: A feeling of persistent discomfort or unease.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't shake off the gnawings of anxiety about the upcoming test.
meanings.sent2: The gnawings of guilt kept him awake at night.
meanings.sent3: The gnawings of boredom during the lecture made her doodle on her notebook.
meanings.sent4: The gnawings of regret haunted him long after the mistake was made.
meanings.sent5: The gnawings of uncertainty in her mind made decision-making difficult.
